- Age ($x_1$): patient's age
- Blood pressure ($x_2$): patient's blood pressure
- Smoking ($x_3$): 1 indicating a smoker and 0 indicating a nonsmoker.

$$

$$

- [ ] When patient's age increase 1 year, the risk of stroke increases 1.08%.
- [ ] When patient's age increase 1 year, the risk of stroke increases 1.08%, while the other two variables (blood pressure and smoke) are hold constant.
